window

Class GameFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • window.GameFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GameFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class will create the JFrame of the game. Features of Version 1.0: The JFrame of the game is created along. The help and about dialogs are created (with the dialog (String title, String text) method) which can be accessed as menu items. Also, there is a quit menu item which can be accessed through the menu bar. An ActionListener is used to detect the user choosing menu bar options (actionPerformed (ActionEvent ae) is used). Hours spent on this class: 4 hours Features of Version 2.0: The startGame method was created to start the actual game after the user is finished with the user input and the main menu. Hours spent on this class (additive to previous version): 4 hours 15 min. Features of Version 3.0: A series of methods were added to control the pausing in the game. A .chm help file was also added to the program. Hours spent on this class (additive to previous version): 5 hours 15 min. Features of Version 5.0: A few changes were made to the data fields stored, and the variables passed in and out in all methods with parameter passes.
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameFrame

        public GameFrame()
        This is the class constructor which will create the actual Frame of the game window along with the menu bar, menus and menu items. The windowClosing method is used to detect when the JFrame window is closed.
        Parameters:
        quitItem - This object reference variable to JMenuItem is used to store/create the Quit item in the File menu.
        helpItem - This object reference variable to JMenuItem is used to store/create the Help item in the Help menu.
        aboutItem - This object reference variable to JMenuItem is used to store/create the About item in the Help menu.
        fileMenu - This object reference variable to JMenu is used to store/create the File menu.
        helpMenu - This object reference variable to JMenu is used to store/create the Help menu.
        myMenus - This object reference variable to JMenuBar is used to store/create the menu bar of the frame.
        appIcon - This object reference variable to ImageIcon is used to store the image that will be used as an icon.
        windowEvent - This Object reference variable to WindowEvent is used to detect if the JFrame window is closed.
        helpFileItem - This object reference variable to JMenuItem is used to create a chm file when the user presses it.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame(boolean shouldRemove)
        This method is used to start the actual game by removing the panel with the main menu and a new panel.
        Parameters:
        type - This boolean is used to store true if the JPanel of the actual game should be removed or not, and false if vice versa.

      • game

        public void game()
        This method is used to create a new Game about which will be added to the JFrame and start the game.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        This method is called when the user wishes to pause the game so that their game can be paused.

      • donePause

        public void donePause(boolean shouldStartTimer)
        This method is used to finish the paused state of the game. The if statement is used to check if the game should be resumed or not. If so, the timer of the game is resumed (animations and processing begin again).
        Parameters:
        shouldStartTimer - This boolean is used to store true if the timer of the game should be started, and false if not.

      • restart

        public void restart(boolean isOnPause)
        This method is used to restart the game that the user is playing by removing that panel, and creating a new instance of it. The if statement is used to check if the game is on pause or not. If so, the pause JPanel is removed.
        Parameters:
        isOnPause - This boolean is used to store true if the game is on pause mode, and false if not.

      • doneGame

        public void doneGame()
        This method is used to close the Game JPanel that the user was playing on, and return to the main menu.

      • getGameInfo

        public GameInfo getGameInfo()
        This method is used to get the instance of the class that stores all of the game info.
        Returns:
        GameInfo This class is returned because it contains all the game info.

      • dialog

        public void dialog(java.lang.String title,
          java.lang.String text)
        This method is used to create the JDialog box that appears as the help or about dialog. The try block is used to catch any BadLocationExceptions that may occur when inserting a String into the DefaultStyledDocument of the JTextPane that is created.
        Parameters:
        title - This object reference variable to String is used to store the title of the JDialog box.
        text - This object reference variable to String is used to store the text that will be displayed in the JDialogBox/ JTextPane.
        sc - This object reference variable to StyleContext is used to set a style context for the styled document that will be used for the JTextPane.
        logo - This object reference variable to Icon is use to store the icon of the company logo.
        doc - This object reference variable to DefaultStyledDocument is used to create style of the JTextPane, and the components in it.
        center - This object reference variable to SimpleAttributeSet is used to center the text on the JTextPane.
        pane - This object reference variable JTextPane is used to create the text pane that will appear on the JDialog box.
        s - This object reference variable to style is used to create the style for the icon on the JTextPane.
        e - This object reference variable to BadLocationException is used to catch any of these Exceptions when inserting strings into the StyledDocument of the JTextPane.
        Throws:
        javax.swing.text.BadLocationException - when inserting strings into a DefaultStyledDocument.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This actionPerformed method is overriden to detect actions within the JFrame. The if statement is used to detect which action has been performed. If the about or help menu items are chosen, a dialog box opens, and if the quit menu item is chosen, the window closes. The try block is used to catch any IOExceptions that may occur when reading the CHM file.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - This object reference variable to ActionEvent is used to detect certain actions performed in the JFrame window.
        e - This object reference variable to IOException is used to catch any of those Exceptions when reading the chm file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when reading the chm file.
